techmeme.title: Netscout: DDoS attacks rose from 13M+ in 2023 to ~17M in 2024, becoming a staple of geopolitical conflict as new tech like AI supercharges their power (Ryan Gallagher/Bloomberg)
Sources: Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corp. is in talks with Fujitsu to help the bank's biggest customers make key decisions using AI-inferred demand predictions (Hideki Suzuki/Bloomberg)
Samsung has turned to Chinese customers like Baidu to prop up its ailing chip business; SemiAnalysis says Samsung is the "biggest supplier of HBM into China" (Financial Times)
Sources: Google is in advanced talks to rent Nvidia Blackwell AI chips from CoreWeave, highlighting how major Nvidia customers are struggling to get chips (The Information)
US announces a 34% "reciprocal" tariff hike on China, going into effect from April 9; economists: average US tariffs on Chinese products may get as high as 65% (Bloomberg)
